page.title: 12POLYAPES CAMP SITE,OXSHOTT
page.content: This permanent camping site is very close to civilisation, yet when you are there it feels like the depths of the country. Two or three{scout groups}come every weekend in spring, summer and autumn, each group camping independently of the others. One end of the site is used by scouts, and the other by cubs. One of the two central fields has a flagpole, behind which there is a scout memorial statue, for all Oxshott scouts lost in the 1st and 2nd world wars. There are two long wooden chalet type buildings for meetings and games, and also a number of low huts, some with beds, and others which are lavatories. The warden and his wife come every week to look after the camp, and to take small subscriptions.
